title: Harnessing The Future Of Digital And Smart Manufacturing Of Medical Devices - Med Device Online
summary: The article discusses the importance of digital and smart manufacturing in the medical device industry to improve efficiency, productivity, and regulatory compliance. It highlights the benefits of embracing digitalization and smart manufacturing, as well as the essential role of product life cycle management systems in the industry.
green_innovation: FALSE - The article does not focus on environmental sustainability goals or reducing negative environmental externalities.
business_innovation: TRUE - The article discusses new or improved processes in medical device manufacturing to enhance efficiency and productivity.
green_product: FALSE - The article does not focus on designing, manufacturing, and using products to reduce environmental impact throughout their life cycles.
green_process: FALSE - The article does not primarily emphasize methods or techniques that minimize environmental impacts and promote sustainability.
greenwashing: FALSE - The article does not contain false or misleading environmental claims but rather discusses the benefits of digitalization and smart manufacturing in the medical device industry.

title: Medtech Innovation Needs a Digital Upgrade | BCG - BCG
summary: The article discusses the need for medtech companies to shift to evergreen platforms focusing on iterative innovation, modular product design, clear interface guidelines, evolved R&D funding models, and user-centric design processes for speed and efficiency.
likely_naics_codes: Likely NAICS Codes: 339112 - Surgical and Medical Instrument Manufacturing, 334510 - Electromedical and Electrotherapeutic Apparatus Manufacturing, 334519 - Other Measuring and Controlling Device Manufacturing, 541715 - Research and Development in the Physical, Engineering, and Life Sciences

title: How businesses can close China's AI talent gap - McKinsey
summary: The article discusses the challenges China faces in attracting and retaining AI talent, particularly in finding data scientists and other AI-related roles, while estimating a growing demand for AI talent in the country by 2030. It also highlights the varying talent needs based on a company's level of digital maturity, prioritizing different skills across digital-maturity archetypes.
likely_naics_codes: Likely NAICS Codes: 541512 - Computer Systems Design Services, 541513 - Computer Facilities Management Services, 541519 - Other Computer Related Services, 611420 - Computer Training

title: Viral Safety With ICH Q5A Revision 2 - BioProcess Insider
summary: The article discusses the updated guidelines for evaluating the viral safety of biotechnological products derived from cell lines of human or animal origins, emphasizing key revisions to address recent scientific advances in the field.
likely_naics_codes: Likely NAICS Codes: 325412, Pharmaceutical Preparation Manufacturing; 541715, Research and Development in the Physical, Engineering, and Life Sciences; 541990, All Other Professional, Scientific, and Technical Services; 624190, Other Individual and Family Services

title: IDM Approach Continues to Strengthen ST's Semiconductor Leadership - EE Times India
summary: The article discusses STMicroelectronics' investments in SiC and GaN technologies to meet the increasing demand for power-efficient solutions and technologies in automotive and industrial applications.
likely_naics_codes: Likely NAICS Codes: 334413 (Semiconductor and Related Device Manufacturing), 334419 (Other Electronic Component Manufacturing), 334515 (Instrument Manufacturing for Measuring and Testing Electricity and Electrical Signals), 335999 (All Other Miscellaneous Electrical Equipment and Component Manufacturing)
